intro: Aspidogyne mendoncae, commonly known as the Mexican aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically have five petals. It produces small, red berries that contain the seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
